poem:
Title: Whistleblower's Refrain

Arms, traded for palms 
in Saudi sand,
Hard winding paths to truth -
Over three decades spanned. 

A report blooms, red,
Unseen no more. 
In public vault, 
its truth unfurls unhindered lore. 

No longer shadowed,
In vaulted austerity,
Emerged from sleights unkindled. 
A stalwart parity.

A fight for light,
through damning fog,
Revealed is the power,
Of the tireless watchdog.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Al-Yamamah arms deal report comes to light ending anti-corruption campaigners’ battle A suppressed official report on alleged corruption in a giant British-Saudi arms contract has been discovered in a public archive, ending a three-decade battle by campaigners for the controversial document to be revealed. The report, which the Guardian is publishing on its website along with various accompanying documents, is believed to be the only inquiry by Britain’s public spending watchdog, the National Audit Office". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
